column4: hi dr. willis sorry for not paying attention...after your instructions it says mount: /dev/sdb: unknown device
type 'ls /dev/sd*'
you're trying to mount sdb?
it looks to not be partitioned
type 'sudo cfdisk /dev/sdb', then quit and tell me what partitions you saw there
you did that through sudo?
if you don't use sudo, it won't read the drive
yes; also try it in another computer, with a different version of linux or with windows or macos, to see if any of those can read the drive
do you have important files on there, or can it be erased?
yes i want the files on it
well, it depends how it's corrupted... data retrieval can be a nontrivial task
ok..lets do it...lets get this non-trivial data back
what are my non-trivial options
actually, I'm supposed to be at lunch now... I'll be back in ~35 minutes, but even then, I can't guarentee anything... im not an expert
the first thing I would try though, is pulling an image with dd, and if that fails, with dd_recover or dc3dd
thats ok..go have lunch and hit me back when u r ready
you can look those up and figure out how to do that, you don't need me to look down those paths
ok will do
/dev/sdb
im back, did you manage to start pulling an image?
can't make image casue can't see device
can't see /dev/sdb anymore at all?
repost, im not going to search through my log
pastebin, not in the channel
